text: Often found in woodlands, Tulip sylvestris is a vigorous, scented, wild tulip. It has bright, buttercup-yellow flowers with a green rib running outside and pointed petals. Flowering in mid-late spring, this tulip is a member of the Botanical Tulips and will happily spread. It is also considered as the "Provincial flower of Balochistan, Pakistan" respectively. Category:Plants of Pakistan Category:Liliaceae Category:Flowers
title: Tulipa sylvestris
